Articles.Content: Hello everyone. Today I just tried installing some graphical mods, including GemFX, but the GemFX only affects the Launcher. Please help

Never heard of GemFX before. A quick look at Google suggests it's an external postprocessing filter tool for games, like ENB/SweetFX.

My suggestion: throw that out, and install Stock Visual Enhancements instead. It's a custom content pack that comes pre-bundled with the three most popular visual mods (Environmental Visual Enhancements, Scatterer, Distant Object Enhancement). Also add Planetshine into the mix.

(Usually I'd also recommend Stock Visual Terrain and RealPlume Stock Configs to go along with it, but their dependencies haven't updated for KSP 1.2 yet.)

well, I actually used this guide https://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/37nedh/installing_mods_to_make_ksp_look_nicer_step_by/

and when using alot of graphical mods the computer crashes more often

Note that several mods recommended in that guide have not yet updated to v1.2. If your game became unstable, this may be a potential cause.

(But then again, if you used CKAN, you should be unable to install outdated mods unless you specifically circumvent the default setting that ensures this.)

Edited October 14, 2016 by Streetwind

the computer crashes mostly occur anytime, but stared more after installing the not CKAN mods, also I use alot of outdated most, and it's fine

Also not sure if it is the mods case, because I always get the same BSOD error message THREAD_STUCK_IN_DEVICE_DRIVER in windows 10

3 hours ago, ajud said:

the computer crashes mostly occur anytime, but stared more after installing the not CKAN mods, also I use alot of outdated most, and it's fine

Also not sure if it is the mods case, because I always get the same BSOD error message THREAD_STUCK_IN_DEVICE_DRIVER in windows 10

 That's generally cause by a driver error. Make sure your completely updated. If you are, then it could be a few other things. As it means the driver cant communicate with the hardware.. including heat effecting the hardware, or a failing PSU rail. Maybe give the fans a dusting, and see if that helps. Does it still do it if you aren't running a game? If it's not driver related, I would assume it's heat or power. As both Rise as you add more graphic enhancements to the mix, and would cause you to crash more often as you added more.

Edited October 14, 2016 by Talavar

well, I reinstalled the GPU driver because it was really annoying that it always told me that hardware changes has been detected, also I'm using laptop, so I can't change too much stuff in it, but the BSOD is just sometimes completely random, because I tried today and I got no BSODs, it's probably was heat or power problem
